subtitle: Medium Undead
description: Acererak is an archlich who travels between worlds and is known to take sick pleasure in devouring the souls of adventurers, whom he lures into trap-ridden dungeons where they suffer horrible deaths. One such dungeon lies under the lost city of Omu. This dungeon is called the Tomb of the Nine Gods, for Acererak slew nine false gods and sealed them within it. More recently, he built a necromantic device called the Soulmonger, then hid it in the heart of the tomb.

name: Albino Dwarf Spirit Warrior
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Dwarf)
description: The albino dwarves of Chult were driven from their subterranean homes by volcanic activity, and those who didn't seek refuge in Port Nyanzaru adapted to living in the jungle. They make armor out of dinosaur hide; shape weapons out of dinosaur bones, flint, and wood; and craft ornate jewelry out of bones, feathers, tusks, and stone beads. Albino dwarves haven't forgotten how to forge metal, but they seldom have the means to do so.

name: Albino Dwarf Warrior
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Dwarf)
description: The albino dwarves of Chult were driven from their subterranean homes by volcanic activity, and those who didn't seek refuge in Port Nyanzaru adapted to living in the jungle. They make armor out of dinosaur hide; shape weapons out of dinosaur bones, flint, and wood; and craft ornate jewelry out of bones, feathers, tusks, and stone beads. Albino dwarves haven't forgotten how to forge metal, but they seldom have the means to do so.

name: Aldani (Lobsterfolk)
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: Many Chultan natives can recall childhood fables of the aldani, the eerie lobsterfolk that lived in the rivers and lakes of their homeland. As there have been no sightings of the aldani in years, it is widely believed that they were wiped out. In truth, many aldani survived and retreated to the lakes of the Aldani Basin in the heart of Chult.

name: Almiraj
subtitle: Small Beast
description: An almiraj (pronounced AWL-meer-ahj) is a large, timid rabbit with a 1-foot-long spiral horn emerging from its forehead, not unlike the horn of a unicorn. If driven to attack, it tries to spear enemies with its horn.

name: Ankylosaurus Zombie
subtitle: Huge Undead
description: Several new zombie variants are presented below. For more information on zombies, see the Monster Manual.

name: Artus Cimber
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Human)
description: A former member of the Harpers, Artus Cimber is the keeper of the Ring of Winter. He found the ring in the jungles of Chult, where he also met his wife, Alisanda. The ring halts its wearer's natural aging and has allowed Artus to survive well beyond his natural lifespan. The ring also defies magical attempts to divine its location and that of its wearer. On his fingers above the knuckles, Artus has tattooed the names of his dearly departed animal companions-a pair of talking wombats named Byrt and Lugg.

name: Asharra
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Aarakocra)
description: Aarakocra range the Howling Gyre, an endless storm of mighty winds and lashing rains that surrounds the tranquil realm of Aaqa in the Elemental Plane of Air. Making aerial patrols, these birdlike humanoids guard the windy borders of their home against invaders from the Elemental Plane of Earth, such as gargoyles, their sworn enemies.

name: Assassin Vine
subtitle: Large Plant
description: An assassin vine is an ambulatory plant that collects its fertilizer by grabbing and crushing prey and depositing the carcasses near its roots. It usually stays put unless it needs to seek out prey. A mature plant consists of a main vine, about 20 feet long. Smaller vines up to 5 feet long branch from the main vine every 6 inches. In late summer, the secondary vines produce bunches of small fruits that resemble wild grapes. The fruit is tough and has a hearty but bitter flavor.

name: Atropal
subtitle: Huge Undead (Titan)
description: An atropal is a ghastly, unfinished creation of an evil god, cast adrift and abandoned long ago. Since an atropal was never truly alive, it can't be raised from the dead or resurrected by any means. Even divine intervention can't breathe true life into this hateful, miserable horror.

name: Bag of Nails
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Tabaxi)
description: Bag of Nails yearns for a hunter's death. Senility has taken hold, and now he sees all creatures as his prey.

name: Chwinga
subtitle: Tiny Elemental
description: A chwinga (pronounced cheh-WING-ah) is a tiny elemental spirit that lives in plants, rocks, and rivers far from civilization. Painfully shy, chwingas prefer to move about unseen.

name: Clay Gladiator
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: A clay gladiator fights if attacked or when called to the gladiatorial pit. If reduced to 0 hit points outside of the gladiatorial pit, the gladiator disappears along with its possessions, reappears in its cell at full health with spear and shield in hand, and returns to the gladiatorial pit if it can. If defeated in the gladiatorial pit, the gladiator leaves its spear behind before reforming in its cell

name: Dragonbait
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Saurial)
description: Dragonbait is a champion of good and a saurial-a race that originated on a distant world and whose members have long lives. Very few saurials dwell in the Forgotten Realms, and no saurial communities are believed to exist anywhere in the world.

name: Eblis
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: Eblis (pronounced EH-blee) are thought to be reincarnations of evil humans who were punished by gods for acts of larceny and kidnapping. These intelligent, evil cranes loom 8 feet tall and lay eggs as mundane birds do. They can manipulate objects with their beaks and feet.

name: Flying Monkey
subtitle: Small Beast
description: Flying monkeys are slightly more clever and curious than common monkeys, and they can be domesticated and taught to obey simple commands. They come in many colors and varieties, with feathered wings that have a span of about 5 feet. With the DM's permission, the __find familiar__ spell can summon a flying monkey.

name: Giant Four-Armed Gargoyle
subtitle: Large Elemental
description: Only Acererak knows the secret of creating these creatures. A giant four-armed gargoyle stands 8 to 9 feet tall and weighs roughly five thousand pounds. It is typically employed as a tomb guardian, rending intruders with its fangs and deadly claws. For more information on gargoyles, see the Monster Manual.

name: Giant Snapping Turtle
subtitle: Large Beast
description: Giant snapping turtles can grow to be 12 feet in diameter. Although they appear slow and ponderous, they are capable of startling bursts of speed and will aggressively attack smaller creatures that approach them. One snap of a giant turtle's jaws can cut a human in half, and these creatures aren't fussy about what they eat.

name: Girallon Zombie
subtitle: Large Undead
description: Several new zombie variants are presented below. For more information on zombies, see the Monster Manual.

name: Hew Hackinstone
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Dwarf)
description: Hailing from uncivilized lands, unpredictable berserkers come together in war parties and seek conflict wherever they can find it.

name: Jaculi
subtitle: Large Beast
description: A jaculi (pronounced jah-KOO-lee) is a 15-foot-long snake that can alter the color and texture of its scales to camouflage itself. Altering its appearance to resemble wood or stone, it coils around pillars and tree trunks from which it launches itself like a javelin, striking with great force and accuracy.

name: Kamadan
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: A kamadan (pronounced KAM-ah-dan) is a feline predator that resembles a leopard with six snakes sprouting from its shoulders. Although it bears a passing resemblance to a displacer beast, the two creatures are unrelated (though some sages claim otherwise).

name: King of Feathers
subtitle: Huge Monstrosity
description: The monstrous tyrannosaurus known as the King of Feathers is the undisputed lord of Omu. Most other dwellers of the Forbidden City live in fear of its thunderous approach and steer well clear of the amphitheater, its lair.

name: Liara Portyr
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Human)
description: As the commander of Fort Beluarian, Liara spends most of her time worrying about the security of her stronghold while cutting deals with pirates. In general, she has no problem with adventurers and will do her utmost to help them deal with the myriad threats lurking in the jungle.

name: Mantrap
subtitle: Large Plant
description: A mantrap is a giant carnivorous plant that resembles an oversized flytrap. To attract prey, the mantrap releases a pollen that magically draws creatures to it. Though it will snap its leafy jaws shut around any warm-blooded creature that strays within its reach, it prefers humanoid prey.

name: Mwaxanaré
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Human)
description: At the tender age of seventeen, Princess Mwaxanaré ("Naré" for short) is the oldest living descendant of the royal families of Omu and the natural inheritor of their fallen kingdom. She and her six-year-old brother, Na, are guests of the aarakocra in Kir Sabal. The aarakocra aim to protect the young royals until such time as the evil in Omu has been vanquished.

name: Pterafolk
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: Pterafolk (pronounced TAIR-eh-folk) are 10-foot-tall, winged, reptilian bipeds native to Chult. Malevolent isolationists, they regard most other creatures as their enemies. In Chultan culture, pterafolk are often referred to as "terror folk" for their habit of swooping down from the sky to snatch whatever and whomever they can, then transporting treasure and food back to their roosts.

name: Ras Nsi
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity (Shapechanger Yuan-Ti)
description: The word "ras" is a noble title akin to "duke." Ras Nsi was once a Chultan paladin, a Chosen of Ubtao and sworn protector of the city of Mezro. He betrayed his oaths and was banished from the city. Becoming a vengeful warlord, Ras Nsi attempted to conquer Mezro with an undead army but was defeated. Rather than seek redemption, he sought revenge and was stripped of his god-given powers. The undead horde, no longer under his control, spread throughout the jungles of Chult.

name: Spiked Tomb Guardian
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: Adventurers who have perished inside the tomb are stitched together by tomb dwarves and bolted into suits of armor. Once complete, these shambling golems are released into the tomb to hunt intruders.

name: Stone Juggernaut
subtitle: Large Construct
description: A stone juggernaut is a rolling construct imbued with enough awareness to avoid obvious dangers such as open pits and chasms. It trundles across open battlefields or rolls down dungeon corridors, crushing anyone in its path. Every stone juggernaut has a unique shape and appearance. One might resemble an elephant with bejeweled tusks, while another might look like a scowling demon with flaming eyes and obsidian teeth.

name: Su-monster
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: Su-monsters are cunning, wicked primates that inhabit forsaken wilderness areas and caves. Adults stand 5 feet tall and have long prehensile tails. Although they can grasp tools and weapons with their tails or clawed feet, su-monsters prefer to rend prey with their claws. Adult su-monsters can also project blasts of psionic energy that leave enemies stunned and unable to flee or defend themselves.

name: Tabaxi Hunter
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Tabaxi)
description: Tabaxi are catfolk who hail from the land of Maztica. The ultimate wanderers, Tabaxi rarely stay in one place for long. They love to collect interesting artifacts, gather tales, and lay eyes on all the world's wonders. This curiosity pushes them to leave no secrets uncovered, and no treasures or legends lost. They revere a fickle deity called the Cat Lord, who is said to wander the world.

name: Tabaxi Minstrel
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Tabaxi)
description: Tabaxi are catfolk who hail from the land of Maztica. The ultimate wanderers, Tabaxi rarely stay in one place for long. They love to collect interesting artifacts, gather tales, and lay eyes on all the world's wonders. This curiosity pushes them to leave no secrets uncovered, and no treasures or legends lost. They revere a fickle deity called the Cat Lord, who is said to wander the world.

name: Tomb Dwarf
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: Acererak abducted dwarf miners and transformed them into wights to exploit their expertise at underground construction.

name: Tomb Guardian
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: Adventurers who have perished inside the tomb are stitched together by tomb dwarves and bolted into suits of armor. Once complete, these shambling golems are released into the tomb to hunt intruders.

name: Tri-flower Frond
subtitle: Medium Plant
description: When fully grown, a tri-flower frond stands 6 to 7 feet tall. It has three bright, trumpet-shaped flowers, each as large as a human head and each one a different color: intense red, vivid orange, and bright yellow. Each flower can harm a creature in a different terrible way.

name: Tyrannosaurus Zombie
subtitle: Huge Undead
description: Several new zombie variants are presented below. For more information on zombies, see the Monster Manual.

name: Valindra Shadowmantle
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: Liches are the remains of great wizards who embrace undeath as a means of preserving themselves. They further their own power at any cost, having no interest in the affairs of the living except where those affairs interfere with their own. Scheming and insane, they hunger for long-forgotten knowledge and the most terrible secrets. Because the shadow of death doesn't hang over them, they can conceive plans that take years, decades, or centuries to come to fruition.

name: Volothamp "Volo" Geddarm
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Human)
description: The bombastic world traveler Volothamp Geddarmn has come to Chult to deliver signed copies of his latest book, Volo's Guide to Monsters. In addition to setting up audiences with the seven merchant princes of Port Nyanzaru (whom he knows well), Volo is visiting local taverns to promote his work, and the characters might meet him at some point in the city. Volo is a font of information (not all of it accurate), but he won't join the party under any circumstances. He might, however, allow the characters to tag along while he visits each merchant prince in turn.

name: Withers
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: Before he was turned into an undead creature, Withers was an Omuan engineer named Gorra. Like all of Omu's citizens, Gorra was enslaved and put to work constructing the tomb. When Acererak sacrificed his workers to their own dungeon, Gorra's traps performed the best.

name: Xandala
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Half-Elf)
description: The half-elf sorcerer Xandala has come to Chult in search of the Ring of Winter, an artifact in Artus Cimber's possession. Xandala knows that the ring has kept Artus alive for over a century, and she craves its power. If she meets the characters, Xandala pretends to be Artus's daughter and tries to convince them to help her find him. Her plan is to cast __dominate person__ on Artus and force him to give her the ring, then escape using her __fly__ spell.

name: Yellow Musk Creeper
subtitle: Medium Plant
description: A yellow musk creeper is an unholy vine whose flowers resemble an orchid's. Bright yellow with splashes of purple, these flowers expel a musk that attracts prey. A yellow musk creeper clings to walls, pillars, gravestones, door frames, or statuary in shadowy locations, remaining motionless until it strikes.

name: Yellow Musk Zombie
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: A yellow musk creeper is an unholy vine whose flowers resemble an orchid's. Bright yellow with splashes of purple, these flowers expel a musk that attracts prey. A yellow musk creeper clings to walls, pillars, gravestones, door frames, or statuary in shadowy locations, remaining motionless until it strikes.

name: Zindar
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Half-Dragon)
description: This half-gold dragon runs Port Nyanzaru's docks and keeps track of ship manifests. A sorcerer of impressive ability, Zindar is well paid by the merchant princes for his work. He is also a key member of the Ytepka Society and a great source of information about the city. Zindar has a soft spot for adventurers, but he knows the dangers of Chult well enough to understand that most of those who embark on expeditions to explore the jungle never return.

name: Zorbo
subtitle: Small Monstrosity
description: A zorbo (pronounced ZOR-boh) is a ferocious omnivore similar in size and appearance to a koala. Living in trees and caves, it has long claws, a dour disposition, and a fondness for humanoid flesh. A zorbo alters its natural armor to match its surroundings, and it can weaken and destroy armor, shields, and protective magic items with its sharp claws.

name: Abominable Beauty
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *An otherworldly humanoid of such indescribable beauty, it pains anyone's eyes to gaze upon her.*

name: Accursed Defiler
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *A gaunt figure in a tattered black mantle shrouded in a cloud of whirling sand. Thin cracks run across its papyrus-dry skin and around its hollow, black eyes.*

name: Adult Cave Dragon
subtitle: Huge Dragon
description: *Covered in black spikes, the dragon's eyeless head swings from side to side. Darkness creeps from its strange, eel-like hide, spreading like ink in water.*

name: Adult Flame Dragon
subtitle: Huge Dragon
description: *The dragon bears black scales, more charred than naturally colored. Cracks between the scales glow a dull red, until the dragon rears its head and roars. Red embers become bright orange flames as the creature lights up from tail to maw*.

name: Adult Mithral Dragon
subtitle: Huge Dragon
description: *Light glints off the dragon's glossy scales, shining silver-white. Its tiny wings folded flush against its body open like a fan and expose shimmering, diaphanous membranes. Its narrow head, with bare slits for its eyes and nostrils, sits at the end of a slender neck atop an impossibly thin frame*.

name: Adult Sea Dragon
subtitle: Huge Dragon
description: *This aquamarine dragon has a shark's head that tapers off into a sleek eel-like body. Its large fins double as wings.*

name: Adult Void Dragon
subtitle: Huge Dragon
description: *A dragon seemingly formed of the night sky has bright white stars for eyes. Lesser stars twinkle in the firmament of the dragon's body.*

name: Adult Wind Dragon
subtitle: Huge Dragon
description: *Howling wind encircles the dragon, filling and pushing its wings without the need for them to beat.*

name: Al-Aeshma Genie
subtitle: Large Elemental
description: *The lower half of this genie is composed of scorching winds and desert sand.*

name: Ala
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *Alas are born from galls that grow on treant trunks. Within this parasitic pocket, an ala sickens the treant and consumes its life force. When the treant dies, the ala is born in a black whirlwind*.

name: Alehouse Drake
subtitle: Tiny Dragon
description: *This plump little creature reclines with a dazed look in its eyes and the suggestion of a grin on its fanged jaws.*

name: Algorith
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: *Sometimes called folding angels, algoriths are lawful beings made from sheer force, pure math, and universal physical laws.*

name: Alseid
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: *Alseids are the graceful woodland cousins to centaurs, with the slender upper body of an elf and the lower body of a deer. Because they are rarely seen far from the wooded glades they call home, they are sometimes called "grove nymphs," despite being more closely related to elves than nymphs.*

name: Amphiptere
subtitle: Medium Beast
description: *A flight of gold-crested, bat-winged serpents bursts from the foliage.*

name: Ancient Cave Dragon
subtitle: Gargantuan Dragon
description: *Covered in black spikes, the dragon's eyeless head swings from side to side. Darkness creeps from its strange, eel-like hide, spreading like ink in water.*

name: Ancient Flame Dragon
subtitle: Gargantuan Dragon
description: *The dragon bears black scales, more charred than naturally colored. Cracks between the scales glow a dull red, until the dragon rears its head and roars. Red embers become bright orange flames as the creature lights up from tail to maw*.Flame dragons are capricious creatures, fascinated by dark emotions and destructive passions. The dragons of eternal fire are proud and jealous, quick to anger, and utterly unforgiving. They bring total ruin to entire civilizations for trivial reasons, but their true motivation is the fun to be had. These burning serpents treat rage, deceit, and despair as toys for their amusement. "May you be the fire's plaything" is a curse often used by the foolish.

name: Ancient Mithral Dragon
subtitle: Gargantuan Dragon
description: *Light glints off the dragon's glossy scales, shining silver-white. Its tiny wings folded flush against its body open like a fan and expose shimmering, diaphanous membranes. Its narrow head, with bare slits for its eyes and nostrils, sits at the end of a slender neck atop an impossibly thin frame*.

name: Ancient Sea Dragon
subtitle: Gargantuan Dragon
description: *This aquamarine dragon has a shark's head that tapers off into a sleek eel-like body. Its large fins double as wings.*

name: Ancient Titan
subtitle: Gargantuan Celestial (Titan)
description: *Radiating a powerful presence, this towering humanoid has sharp-edged features that seem hewn from ancient stone.*

name: Ancient Void Dragon
subtitle: Gargantuan Dragon
description: *A dragon seemingly formed of the night sky has bright white stars for eyes. Lesser stars twinkle in the firmament of the dragon's body.*

name: Ancient Wind Dragon
subtitle: Gargantuan Dragon
description: *Howling wind encircles the dragon, filling and pushing its wings without the need for them to beat.*Wind dragons view anywhere touched by air as their property, and mortals point to them as the epitome of arrogance. Their narcissism is not without reason, for awe‑inspiring power supports their claims of rightful control. To the dragons of the shifting gales, strength is the ultimate arbiter.

name: Angatra
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *The withered creature wrapped in gore-stained rags pulls back a tattered hood to reveal glowing eyes hungry with bloodlust.*

name: Angler Worm
subtitle: Huge Monstrosity
description: *As patient as a fisherman, the angler worm lights a beacon in the darkness and waits for its next meal.*

name: Annelidast
subtitle: Huge Monstrosity
description: *The massive worm erupted from the earth, crushing all near it and scooping up the remains.*

name: Anubian
subtitle: Medium Elemental
description: *Swirling sand comes together to form a snarling, canine-faced humanoid whose eyes shine with an eerie, blue glow.*

name: Apau Perape Demon
subtitle: Large Fiend (Demon)
description: *Sharp teeth fill this large, demonic ape's mouth. Its long, muscular arms stretch to the ground, ending in wickedly curved claws.*

name: Arboreal Grappler
subtitle: Medium Aberration
description: *Long, simian arms snake through the trees like furred serpents, dangling from a shaggy, striped ape in the leafy canopy above and trying to snare those below.*

name: Arcane Guardian
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *A luminous green mist swirls into the form of an ancient warrior. Dented armor and a ragged cloak enshroud the warrior's skeletal body, and its grinning skull leers out from an open helm.*

name: Arch-Devil Ia'Affrat
subtitle: Large Fiend
description: *A dark, droning cloud containing thousands of gray, thumb-sized wasps, shifts and swarms around the black silhouette of a tall human with glowing red eyes. The wasps, too, glow with the heat of a low-burning coal and are wreathed in foul-smelling smoke.*

name: Aridni
subtitle: Small Fey
description: *The gray, moth-winged fey flies out from the trees in a hail of tiny arrows.*

name: Arx
subtitle: Large Fiend
description: *This spike-covered insectoid stands at the ready with a wicked spear grasped by two limbs. It decompresses its wings impossibly to fashion a pair of walls behind it, held together and connected to the insectoid by a stretchy pink goo.*

name: Asanbosam
subtitle: Large Aberration
description: *A hirsute hulk with bulging, bloodshot eyes perches high in a tree, ready to seize unwary passersby with its rusty, hook-like talons.*

name: Ash Drake
subtitle: Small Dragon
description: *A lean and dull-scaled drake perches on a chimney as if it just crawled out, its tail still hanging into the flue as smoke billows out.*

name: Ashwalker
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *A winged shadow eclipsed the sun, and an inferno consumed the city. An ashen corpse rose from the dirt and walked the charred streets as if its world had not just been incinerated.*

name: Automata Devil
subtitle: Large Fiend (Devil)
description: *A nightmare wrapped in chains and held together by cutting cogs and whirring gears, this fiend howls like a hurricane in battle.*

name: Azza Gremlin
subtitle: Small Fey
description: *These tiny, hairless, rail-thin creatures crackle with static electricity. Arcs of lightning snap between their long ears.*

name: Baba Yaga's Horsemen
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *These mounted knights wield great weapons as swift as dawn, as bright as the blazing sun, and as cold as the grave. The white horseman is a young rider full of promise, the red rider a man in his prime, and the black rider a scarred and bearded fellow, his eyes dark and his mouth set in a grim frown. They ride with purpose on powerful steeds*.

name: Bagiennik
subtitle: Medium Aberration
description: *With webbed claws, bulbous eyes, and two nostril-slits that ooze an oily black substance, the creature is not quite hideous—but it might be, if most of it wasn't concealed by a thick coating of muck and mud.*

name: Bandit Lord
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Any Race)
description: Not just the leader of a simple gang, the bandit lord has gathered a small army of outlaws and brigands together through force of personality, wit, and strength of arms. To keep those followers in line, the bandit leader must rely on loyal captains whom the bandit lord rewards for their successes and brutally punishes for their failures.

name: Bastet Temple Cat
subtitle: Small Monstrosity
description: *A slim feline far larger than any house cat slips from the shadows. Its coat glistens like ink as it chirps, and its tail flicks teasingly as its golden eyes observe the doings in its temple.*

name: Bear King
subtitle: Medium Fey (Shapechanger)
description: *Dressed in hunting leathers with a thick bearskin cloak around his shoulders, the bearded king sits upon a throne carved from a whole tree trunk. A crown of holly leaves wreathes his head, and a blackened maul rests near his hand. An ornate clay pot filled with honey hangs at his hip*.

name: Bearfolk
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Bearfolk)
description: *Although it has the head of a shaggy bear, this humanoid creature wears armor and carries a battleaxe in one massive, clawed hand and a warhammer in the other. It's a solid slab of muscle that towers over most humans.*

name: Beggar Ghoul
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *This emaciated, gray husk of a creature wears rags and picks hungrily at a sliver of bone. It moves in a crouch so low that it's almost crawling, but its eyes glow like flickering coals and it exudes a desperate ferocity with each rot-fouled breath.*

name: Beheaded Vengeful Spirit
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *The ghostly humanoid floats through the air, its head hovering several inches above its severed neck.*

name: Behtu
subtitle: Small Humanoid
description: *With the face of a mandrill and the tusks of a great boar, these ferocious half-ape, half-human pygmies have demon blood flowing in their veins. Only the desperate or the suicidal travel to their volcanic temple-islands.*

name: Beli
subtitle: Small Fey
description: *With their pale skin and translucent wings, these winter fairies blend perfectly into their snowy environment. Only their beady black eyes stand out against the snow and ice.*

name: Bereginyas
subtitle: Tiny Fey
description: *These small, winged faeries appear to be made of gray mist, and they can conceal themselves completely in the fogbanks and clouds enshrouding their mountainous lairs.*

name: Berstuc Demon
subtitle: Large Fiend (Demon)
description: *Although slightly stooped, this male figure is muscular and broad‑shouldered. The creature's head is lost in a riot of moss, while a thick mustache and beard reach almost to its waist.*

name: Black Knight Commander
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Any Race)
description: The black knight commander strikes an imposing figure upon its chosen mount; one that inspires bloodlust in its allies and fear in its foes. Devoted to its own twisted code, the black knight commander has a sense of honor but spares no compassion for those who stand in its way. Whether the knight fights for a dark lord or a demonic god, all its foes will be trampled into the dust and their families slaughtered so there can be no revenge. The only victory is a total victory.

name: Blemmyes
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: *This headless giant has a large mouth in its chest with eyes bulging out on either side of it.*

name: Blood Hag
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *This bent-backed crone has long, leathery arms and cruel, flesh-shearing talons. Her face is a misshapen mass of leathery flesh with a bulbous nose, like a gnarled knot on an old oak tree, and her hair falls in ringlets of wriggling worms.*

name: Boloti
subtitle: Tiny Fey
description: *This small, leering water spirit resembles a cross between a gray frog and a damp scarecrow, with small tendrils sprouting from all its extremities. It has water wings seemingly made out of jellyfish flesh.*

name: Bone Collective
subtitle: Small Undead
description: *Thousands of tiny bones coalesce into a humanoid form, then disperse in a clattering swarm the next moment. The bones rustle as the creature moves, a sound like sand sliding down a dune.*

name: Bone Crab
subtitle: Small Beast
description: *The cracked skull scurries forward on bone-white legs, crab claws raised.*

name: Bone Swarm
subtitle: Large Undead
description: *Dank winds sweep up skeletons, both humanoid and animal. They blow forward, reaching out for living creatures like a clawed hand of bone. A scattering of bones rolls across the ground, then rises into the air, billowing like a sheet*.

name: Bonepowder Ghoul
subtitle: Small Undead
description: *Distilled to nothing but dry, whispering sand and a full set of teeth, this ghoulish creature still hungers for flesh and blood.*

name: Bouda
subtitle: Medium Fiend (Shapechanger)
description: *A hulking, hyena-faced humanoid with a heavily scarred, oversized muzzle steps forward, clouds of gnats and fleas roiling around it.*

name: Broodiken
subtitle: Tiny Construct
description: *Tiny and built like a caricature of a person, this creature's enlarged head is filled with pointed teeth.*

name: Bucca
subtitle: Tiny Fey
description: *These tiny, obsidian-skinned, bat-winged fey have a hungry look. Leering with razor-sharp fangs bared, they licking their leathery faces with their forked, purple tongues.*

name: Bukavac
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: *Unleashing a bone-shattering roar, this toad-like monster bears two gnarled horns and wicked claws. It charges from its watery lair on six legs, eager for the kill.*

name: Buraq
subtitle: Medium Celestial
description: *An aura of holiness surrounds this handsome human-headed equine with short but strong feathered wings.*

name: Burrowling
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Burrowling)
description: *These light brown, furred creatures inquisitively survey their surroundings, each comforted by the presence of the others.*

name: Cactid
subtitle: Large Plant
description: *Rootlike tendrils explode from the sand at the base of this tall cactus bristling with needles. Its tendrils reach out, seeking prey.*

name: Cambium
subtitle: Large Fiend
description: *Unfolding impossibly from beneath voluminous robes, this creature's pockmarked, spindly arms end in clusters of narrow spikes. Its long, hollow, needle-like fingers and its many-jointed arms move with surprising speed and strength for such an emaciated creature.*

name: Carrion Beetle
subtitle: Large Beast
description: *The beetles wore golden bridles and carried huge leather sacks of stone and guano. They marched without stopping; dozens, even hundreds, bringing fresh earth to the white-fungus trees of the great forests. Their claws skittered with a sound like horseshoes slipping on stone, but their multiple legs ensured they never fell. The air around them singed the nostrils with the taint of acid*.

name: Caustic Charger
subtitle: Huge Monstrosity
description: *This massive hexapod trundles along, the dangling tentacles festooning its squat body barely clearing the ground. A bony brow ridge set over beady eyes dominates its head.*

name: Cave Dragon Wyrmling
subtitle: Medium Dragon
description: *Covered in black spikes, the dragon's eyeless head swings from side to side. Darkness creeps from its strange, eel-like hide, spreading like ink in water.*

name: Cavelight Moss
subtitle: Large Plant
description: *These patches of tangled, lacy moss cling to the ceiling, slowly pulsing with an eerie glow. Their stems gently writhe among the soft, feathery mass, dusting the ground below with a twinkling of phosphorescent spores.*

name: Chained Angel
subtitle: Medium Celestial
description: *The angel's dark halo, flayed skin, and soulless, rage-filled eyes hint at the horrors it endured to end up shackled at the feet of the demon.*

name: Chelicerae
subtitle: Large Aberration
description: *The massive spider stands perched on tall, stilted legs, and the disheveled body of a robed arcanist swings from its clenched mandibles.*

name: Chernomoi
subtitle: Tiny Fey
description: *These batwinged fey sport horns, scales, and other minor draconic features.*

name: Child of the Briar
subtitle: Tiny Plant
description: *Its eyes gleam like polished walnuts, and its sly smile seems oddly placed on the tiny body, covered in spikes and thorns. The creature's waist is no thicker than a clenched fist, and its sinuous arms are no wider than a finger but twice the length of its body.*

name: Chort Devil
subtitle: Medium Fiend
description: *Small horns crown this pig-faced devil's head. It stands on shaggy goat legs and holds a flaming polearm in its clawed hands. It bears a wicked gleam in its black eyes*.

name: Chronalmental
subtitle: Large Elemental
description: *A chronalmental is difficult to pin down, and it may appear as a large man-shaped absence in the air that reveals first a field of stars, then a contorted rainbow of colored bands, then a brilliant white light, strobing in and out of existence.*

name: Cikavak
subtitle: Tiny Fey
description: *A dark gray comb flops atop the head of this remarkably ugly bird, and shapeless wattles dangle from its throat.*

name: Citrullus
subtitle: Medium Plant
description: *The humble melon plant slowly rises up, its striped melon splitting to reveal a maw of teeth and a gullet full of seed-filled, oozing fruit flesh.*

name: City Watch Captain
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Any Race)
description: With its talents, the city watch captain could easily have been on the other side of the law, but the captain likes the respect the position commands within the city, especially when leading a patrol of guards. While a trained investigator, the city watch captain is not afraid to draw its blade to end a threat to its city. The captain maintains a no-nonsense stance when on duty and adheres to the laws of whichever city it protects. Some city watch captains let their power and authority go to their heads, while others wear the office like a badge of pride, laying down their lives in defense of the city and its citizens.

name: Clockwork Abomination
subtitle: Large Construct
description: *The pile of debris and scrap on the ground suddenly rises, revealing a large insectoid form with smoke rising between the plates of its hide. Its many orange-yellow eyes shine like dim lanterns and reveal no hint of expression or intent.*

name: Clockwork Beetle
subtitle: Tiny Construct
description: *Gleaming metal and whirring gears make up the form of this elaborate mechanical insect the size of a housecat.*

name: Clockwork Beetle Swarm
subtitle: Large Construct
description: *Gleaming metal and whirring gears make up the form of this elaborate mechanical insect the size of a housecat.*

name: Clockwork Hound
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: *This black, mechanical hunting dog keeps its nose to the ground sniffing and whuffling. Gleaming teeth fill its metal mouth.*

name: Clockwork Huntsman
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: *The mechanical soldier is clad in flat-black armor, and beneath its breastplate, gears tick and whir.*

name: Clockwork Myrmidon
subtitle: Large Construct
description: *This hulking brass and iron creature resembles a giant suit of plate armor. A constant growl issues from its midsection. Its squat head wears an angry expression, and it moves with powerful, determined grace*.

name: Clockwork Watchman
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: *This mechanical being's body is composed of brass and iron, bedecked in a loose uniform of the city watch. Its movements are slow but steady.*

name: Clockwork Weaving Spider
subtitle: Tiny Construct
description: *This mechanical spider has long, spindly legs, including one equipped with a sharp blade that's disproportionately large for the creature's body.*

name: Clurichaun
subtitle: Tiny Fey
description: *Around a corner in the wine cellar stumbles a tiny, surly man carrying an open bottle of wine. He has a bushy beard and wears a rumpled, red overcoat over a dirty white shirt and knee-length red trousers with blue stockings and silver-buckled shoes. A cap made from leaves stitched together with gold thread slouches atop his head, and he reeks of stale beer and wine*.

name: Cobbleswarm
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: *The paving stones underfoot suddenly lurch and tumble over one another. Thousands of tiny limbs, pincers, and stingers break from the stony surface and frantically scuttle forward.*

name: Coral Drake
subtitle: Medium Dragon
description: *Swimming upright, this creature peels itself from the vibrant seascape and strikes with spined fins, shredding teeth, and a wickedly curved stinger.*

name: Corpse Mound
subtitle: Huge Undead
description: *The reeking pile of bodies and bones, as large as a giant, lurches forward. Corpses that tumble off it rise moments later as undead and follow the determined hill of corruption.*

name: Corrupted Ushabti
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *The eye sockets of the funerary figure's ornate death mask suddenly ignite with a golden radiance. With the creak of long-unused limbs, this towering figure in ancient armor raises its weapons once more.*Ushabtis are placed in tombs as servants in the afterlife for those buried there—as both a laborer in the kingdom of the dead and a guardian in the kingdom of the living. These sentinels tend to the physical work and maintenance required after death that is beyond the abilities of those of flesh and blood. Dressed in ceremonial regalia, they are sometimes mistaken for living beings by those who would intrude upon their domain, but careful examination reveals faintly glowing hieroglyphs graven into their garments and bodies.

name: Corrupting Ooze
subtitle: Large Ooze
description: *The ooze boils and bubbles with rank marsh gas and the fetid stench of the sewer. It leaves a stinking trail of acidic slime wherever it goes.*

name: Crimson Drake
subtitle: Tiny Dragon
description: *Crimson drakes are easy to spot, with scales the color of dried blood, a deadly scorpion stinger, and a mischievous gleam in their eyes.*

name: Crystalline Devil
subtitle: Medium Fiend (Devil)
description: *This gem-encrusted devil grins with jagged teeth and bares claws as sharp as glass.*

name: Darakhul
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *Intelligence gleams in the eyes of the well-dressed ghoul. It smiles a greeting, barely revealing sharp teeth.*

name: Dau
subtitle: Small Fey
description: *A constant shimmer surrounds this short, winged creature. Staring at it is eye-watering and confusing, like a distant desert mirage, though it's scant yards away.*

name: Death Butterfly Swarm
subtitle: Large Beast
description: *Enormous clouds of orange and green butterflies add a reek of putrefaction to the air, stirred by the flapping of delicate wings.*

name: Deathcap Myconid
subtitle: Medium Plant
description: *This fungal creature's head extends up and out in an orange and red cap with white spots. A vicious-looking fanged maw dominates its face.*

name: Deathwisp
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *A shadowy figure flickers in and out of view. Its indistinct shape betrays a sylvan ancestry, and its eyes are malevolent blue points of light.*

name: Deep Drake
subtitle: Large Dragon
description: *This large, unnerving drake's glassy black scales have purple undertones. Its features are elongated and almost alien. Black, expressionless eyes stare ahead, and a barbed stinger sits at the end of a long tail*.

name: Deep One
subtitle: Medium Humanoid
description: *These fishlike folk have enormous eyes, a wide mouth, and almost no chin.*

name: Deep One Archimandrite
subtitle: Large Humanoid
description: *These fishlike folk have enormous eyes, a wide mouth, and almost no chin.*

name: Deep One Priest
subtitle: Medium Humanoid
description: *These fishlike folk have enormous eyes, a wide mouth, and almost no chin.*

name: Degenerate Titan
subtitle: Huge Giant
description: *This giant retains a look of daunting power despite its stooped bearing, tattered clothing, and pieces of slapdash armor strapped on wherever it fits.*

name: Demon Lord Akyishigal
subtitle: Large Fiend (Demon)
description: *This insectoid creature's filth-slicked mandibles clack ceaselessly for flesh.*

name: Demon Lord Camazotz
subtitle: Large Fiend (Demon)
description: *This hunched, lean man is covered in short, black fur and has large, membranous wings. His lips, pulled back in a sinister smile, reveal a mouth lined with crooked, needlelike teeth. His eyes glow red like burning embers of hate. Long arms end in cruel claws, and the air around him shimmers with waves of intense heat*.

name: Demon Lord Mechuiti
subtitle: Gargantuan Fiend (Demon)
description: *A yellow-green fire burns atop the head of this towering, redfurred demon, which resembles an enormous mandrill. It has massive, muscular arms tipped with razor-sharp claws, a slavering jaw filled with huge fangs, and tusks that curl back almost to its blue cheeks.*

name: Demon Lord Qorgeth
subtitle: Gargantuan Fiend (Demon)
description: *This massive undulating worm-like creature crushes trees and cracks stone.*

name: Derro Fetal Savant
subtitle: Tiny Humanoid (Derro)
description: *This creature resembles a blue-skinned dwarven infant, no older than a year. Its limbs flail, its head lolls with an obvious lack of coordination, and it screams incessantly.*

name: Derro Shadow Antipaladin
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Derro)
description: *This blue-skinned creature resembles a stunted dwarf. Its colorless eyes are large, and its white hair is wild. The expression on its face is a terrible rictus of madness and hate*.

name: Desert Giant
subtitle: Huge Giant
description: *The towering woman rises up from the desert sand. Her pale brown robe almost perfectly matches the gritty terrain, and her roughly textured skin is a rich walnut brown.*

name: Devilbound Gnome
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Gnome)
description: The devilbound gnome is a gnome spellcaster that has made a magical agreement with a devil for greater power. To ensure loyalty and to further the gnome's power, the devil binds an imp to the gnome's service. This binding changes the gnome, giving it fiendish protections and minor fiendish features, such as glowing eyes, a sulfurous aroma, a forked tongue, or similar. Beyond fulfilling the occasional demand, the devil cares little for what the gnome does with the power, provided the flow of souls doesn't cease.

name: Dipsa
subtitle: Tiny Ooze
description: *Except for a pair of tiny fangs, the entire body of this yellowishgreen worm looks like a ropy tangle of slime-covered tubes and puddles of mucus.*

name: Dissimortuum
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *This twisted humanoid has gray flesh and black claws that drip blood. A bone mask is bound to its head by strips of putrid flesh, and a third arm hangs from the right side of the creature's body, its hand clutching a large sack stained with blood.*

name: Dogmole
subtitle: Medium Beast
description: *This mole-like creature is the size of a large dog, with a thick, barrel-shaped body. A ring of tentacles sprouts above a mouth dominated by spade-like incisors, and cataracts fill its tiny eyes.*

name: Dogmole Juggernaut
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: *This mole-like creature is the size of a large dog, with a thick, barrel-shaped body. A ring of tentacles sprouts above a mouth dominated by spade-like incisors, and cataracts fill its tiny eyes.*

name: Domovoi
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *The creature resembles a large, stony goblin, with an oversized head and leering grin. It has a mossy beard, massive shoulders, and long forearms.*

name: Doppelrat
subtitle: Tiny Monstrosity
description: *Within seconds, the startled rat became four, and then the four multiplied into sixteen rats.*

name: Dorreq
subtitle: Medium Aberration
description: *These twitching balls of tentacles surround an inhuman face dominated by a squid-like beak.*

name: Dragon Eel
subtitle: Huge Dragon
description: *This slender aquatic creature sports a powerful single finned tail and wicked jaws like a matched pair of serrated blades.*

name: Dragonleaf Tree
subtitle: Large Plant
description: *The dragon-headed leaves of these oak trees sometimes rustle despite a lack of wind, betraying a hint that they're more than they seem.*

name: Drakon
subtitle: Large Dragon
description: *These winged snakes are coastal beasts and sometimes confused with true dragons or wyverns. They are neither, but quite deadly in their own right.*

name: Dream Eater
subtitle: Medium Fiend
description: *This tattered skeletal humanoid resembles a monster from a nightmare with vestigial skeletal wings with a few feathers, small horns, sharp teeth, and cloven hooves.*

name: Drowned Maiden
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *A drowned woman floating in the water, her long hair drifting around her, suddenly rises! Her hair strikes out like dozens of watery snakes.*

name: Dullahan
subtitle: Large Fey
description: *The black horse strides out of the shadows with its nostrils huffing steam. Its rider, swathed in black leather, raises its arm to reveal not a lantern but its own severed, grinning head.*

name: Dune Mimic
subtitle: Huge Monstrosity (Shapechanger)
description: *The sand surges and shifts, a sinkhole opens, and sandy tendrils reach out.*

name: Duskthorn Dryad
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *This striking woman with obvious fey features and skin the color of slate sits in the shade of an ancient, vine-wrapped tree. Clothed in vines and leaves, she is almost indistinguishable from the tree.*

name: Dust Goblin
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Goblinoid)
description: *A ragged creature emerges from the sand. Its spindly frame is encased in a hodge-podge of armor scraps and rusted weapons. A long, hooked nose protrudes over a wide mouth filled with sharp teeth*.

name: Dwarven Ringmage
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Dwarf)
description: Curves are seldom seen in the stacked blocks and precise geometric forms of dwarven architecture. Devoid of angles and planes with no beginning and no end, circles are a mystery and hold power. Dwarven ringmages are those dwarves who have mastered the art of tapping into that power, imbuing it into metal rings and their spellcasting. Rings and circles are sacred to them, and they read omens in the cycle of seasons, the shape of flowers, and in a storm's first rain drops.

name: Eala
subtitle: Small Monstrosity
description: *This swanlike creature's feathers are made of shining metal. When it inhales, the feathers on its chest glow red hot.*

name: Eater of Dust
subtitle: Medium Aberration
description: *This terrible creature resembles an imposing knight wearing baroque plate armor made of calcified resin. Its helm is a blank gray oval without eye slots or mouthpiece, and one of its arms ends in a slavering, fanged mouth.*

name: Edimmu
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *An evil wind swirls out of the desert, parching those it touches and whispering evil plans.*

name: Eel Hound
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *The grotesque beast has the muscular tail, bulbous head, and rubbery, slime-covered flesh of an eel. Its torso and webbed paws resemble those of a misshapen canine, while needle-sharp teeth fill its menacing jaws.*

name: Einherjar
subtitle: Medium Humanoid
description: *A line of stout, bearded warriors with golden auras stand ready, adorned in chain mail and carrying battle axes and oaken shields. Their badges and symbols are all different, and no two have the same braided pattern in their beards.*

name: Elder Shadow Drake
subtitle: Large Dragon
description: *A large dragon with black scales and shadowy wings emerges from the darkness. Its red eyes glare bright as coals, and it speaks in a deep monotone.*

name: Elemental Locus
subtitle: Gargantuan Elemental
description: *The ground ripples and tears as rocks fall, jets of flame erupt, and howling winds rage around a rocky creature.*

name: Elvish Veteran Archer
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Elf)
description: The elvish veteran archer is a stealthy hunter that quietly slips through the wood, watching for game or intruders. While capable with a sword, the elvish archer's true skill lies with the longbow. When unseen, the archer can launch a volley of arrows at its foes with deadly results.

name: Emerald Eye
subtitle: Tiny Construct
description: *This floating, green crystal sparkles with an inviting glow above the head of a fallen figure.*

name: Emerald Order Cult Leader
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Any Race)
description: The Emerald Order cult leader has embraced the mysteries of the Emerald Tablet and has bent its worship of Thoth-Hermes to furthering the efforts of the Order. The cult leader seeks to gather arcane and alchemical knowledge wherever it is found by any means necessary. If subtle manipulations fail, the cult leader is not above using lethal methods to ensure the cult's goals are met.

name: Empty Cloak
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: *This dark cloth of black and purple, stitched with silver and golden threads, resembles a garment of elvish make. Smoke sometimes billows under the hood.*

name: Eonic Drifter
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Human)
description: *The air crackles and lights flicker in the ruins. In a whirl of colorful robes, a gaunt human materializes from the maelstroms of time. His eyes scan the hall in panic, witnessing an event only he can see*.

name: Erina
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Erina)
description: *This small humanoid has a slightly pointed face with bright, brown eyes and a black, snout-like nose. Its skin is covered in short, tan fur, and its head, shoulders, and back have smoothed-down quills.*

name: Erina Defender
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Erina)
description: *This small humanoid has a slightly pointed face with bright, brown eyes and a black, snout-like nose. Its skin is covered in short, tan fur, and its head, shoulders, and back have smoothed-down quills.*

name: Eye Golem
subtitle: Large Construct
description: *Eye-like sigils dot the smooth, marble skin of this statue. One of the eye sigils opens, and a beam of brilliant light shines out.*

name: Far Darrig
subtitle: Small Fey
description: *This small man wears hunting leathers and a cowl decorated with antlers, and he holds a glaive made of antlers.*

name: Fate Eater
subtitle: Medium Aberration
description: *Violet radiance surrounds this large pale centipede. Its flesh is translucent, and its jaws are crystalline.*

name: Fear Smith
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *This well-dressed figure appears elven, save for its featureless face and taloned hands.*

name: Fellforged
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: *A darkly foreboding intelligence glows behind this automaton's eyes, and its joints seep hissing green vapors.*

name: Fext
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *Taut dead skin, adorned entirely with tattooed fish scales, covers this woman's face and hands. She wears scaled armor, sea green like verdigris on copper, and wields a sword swirling with arcane energies. Her pale eyes stare, unblinking*.

name: Feyward Tree
subtitle: Huge Construct
description: *Dark, bark-like rust encrusts the trunk of this metal tree, and its dull metallic leaves rustle with the sound of sharp metal.*

name: Fidele Angel
subtitle: Medium Celestial (Shapechanger)
description: *What appears to be a mated pair of birds changes into two bestial celestials that move in perfect harmony.*

name: Firebird
subtitle: Small Celestial
description: *This proud bird struts like a peacock, made all the more majestic by its flaming fan of feathers, which shift through the color spectrum.*

name: Firegeist
subtitle: Small Elemental
description: *Wisps of black smoke and spots of bright flame coalesce into a vaguely humanoid shape.*

name: Flab Giant
subtitle: Large Giant
description: *This obese, bell-shaped giant is blemished by ulcers, enlarged veins, and fungal rashes. Though it stumbles about on a pair of short, calloused legs, it moves its weight with dangerous potential.*

name: Flame Dragon Wyrmling
subtitle: Medium Dragon
description: *The dragon bears black scales, more charred than naturally colored. Cracks between the scales glow a dull red, until the dragon rears its head and roars. Red embers become bright orange flames as the creature lights up from tail to maw*.Flame dragons are capricious creatures, fascinated by dark emotions and destructive passions. The dragons of eternal fire are proud and jealous, quick to anger, and utterly unforgiving. They bring total ruin to entire civilizations for trivial reasons, but their true motivation is the fun to be had. These burning serpents treat rage, deceit, and despair as toys for their amusement. "May you be the fire's plaything" is a curse often used by the foolish.

name: Flutterflesh
subtitle: Large Undead
description: *This mass of fused corpses resembles a butterfly with wings of skin, limbs of bone, and a head formed of several different skulls. The dark magic that formed this abomination swirls around it hungrily.*

name: Folk of Leng
subtitle: Medium Humanoid
description: *This person has goatlike legs, small horns partially hidden beneath a hood, and a mouth full of rows of serrated teeth. Its clothes are a mixture of heavy leathers and bright silks.*

name: Forest Marauder
subtitle: Large Giant
description: *A relatively diminutive giant stalks beneath the forest's dark canopy, large spear in hand.*

name: Fraughashar
subtitle: Small Fey
description: *This slight creature resembles a goblin, but its blue skin and the icicles hanging from the tip of its long nose speak to the chilling truth.*

name: Frostveil
subtitle: Medium Plant
description: *"They took the sled dogs first, and later the seal-skinner set to guard them. We'd hear a confused, muffled cry in the wind and then we'd find them—a raven harvest, cold and stiff on the ice. Next time, we hid ourselves and watched, and we saw them floating through the air like kites. A wisp of blowing snow that never dispersed, a billowing, snowflake sail moving with sinister purpose. The 'cloak of death' our guide called it."*

name: Garroter Crab
subtitle: Tiny Beast
description: *This blue-black freshwater crab scuttles through the mud by the stream, searching for prey.*

name: Gbahali
subtitle: Huge Beast
description: *This large reptile has dagger-like teeth and a scaly hide of shifting colors.*

name: Gearforged Templar
subtitle: Medium Construct
description: *The bronze and mithral figure advances with heavy movements. Its eye lenses glare a golden hue, and gears click when it swings its greatsword.*

name: Gerridae
subtitle: Large Fey
description: *This large water-striding insect resembles a strange cross between a camel and a wingless, long-legged locust. A large hollow in the small of its back holds enough space for a rider.*

name: Ghost Knight
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *The skeleton's armor creaks as its decaying mount shifts and emits a ghostly whinny. The skeleton sets its lance, skulls dangling from the hilt, and charges.*

name: Ghostwalk Spider
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: *A pasty-white spider the size of a horse slinks through the shadows. It fades from sight with a ghostly blue shimmer.*

name: Giant Ant
subtitle: Large Beast
description: *Several pony-sized ants swarm around an ant the size of a draft horse, clacking their serrated mandibles and threatening with their stingers.*

name: Giant Ant Queen
subtitle: Large Beast
description: *Several pony-sized ants swarm around an ant the size of a draft horse, clacking their serrated mandibles and threatening with their stingers.*

name: Gilded Devil
subtitle: Medium Fiend (Devil)
description: *This tall, bronze-complexioned man is abnormally long-limbed and clad in armor of stained and battered coins. His wiry frame is festooned with mismatched bracelets, rings, and necklaces, each gaudier than the last.*

name: Glass Gator
subtitle: Large Beast
description: *A near-transparent crocodilian creature leaps from the water, the remnants of its last meal still visible in its transparent gut.*

name: Gnarljak
subtitle: Small Construct
description: *A bear trap springs to clacking life, ready to tear flesh.*

name: Gnoll Havoc Runner
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Gnoll)
description: *A sprinting gnoll laughs as it runs, axe held high and flashing in the sun.*

name: Goat-Man
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: *This hunched, man-like figure lurches with a strange, half-hopping gait. Tattered clothing hangs from its muscled shoulders, and its legs are those of a ram, ending in cloven hooves.*

name: Gray Thirster
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *This dried-out body of a long dead traveler is still clad in the tattered remains of its clothes. Its skin, as dry as parchment, clings to its bones, and a hoarse moaning emanates from its dry, cracked lips.*

name: Greater Death Butterfly Swarm
subtitle: Huge Beast
description: *Enormous clouds of orange and green butterflies add a reek of putrefaction to the air, stirred by the flapping of delicate wings.*

name: Greyfur
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Lemurfolk)
description: *This furred humanoid glides silently through the canopy of trees, gripping a blowgun. It observes visitors cautiously with two intelligent, bulbous eyes.*

name: Grim Jester
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *A skeletal cadaver bedecked in the motley attire of a fool capers about while making jokes that mock mortality.*

name: Gug
subtitle: Huge Giant
description: *The giant, four-armed, two-legged creature steps forward, long claws extended. A large toothy mouth splits its torso from shoulders to navel.*

name: Gypsosphinx
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: *With black wings and a body pale as alabaster, the vulture-beaked sphinx is a striking figure.*

name: Haugbui
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *A thick swirl of dust rises, settles, and forms the vague outline of a human—two points of yellow light shine where its eyes should be, staring malevolently.*

name: Herald of Blood
subtitle: Huge Fiend
description: *The giant has bruised, purple skin and wart-like blood blisters that deform its features. It wears cowled robes, and its staff is ebony and mithral embedded with precious stones.*

name: Herald of Darkness
subtitle: Large Fiend
description: *A tall and beautiful fiend, this creature resembles a dark-haired fey wearing a cloak and armor glittering with dark light.*

name: Hoard Golem
subtitle: Huge Construct
description: *A pile of gold, jewelry, and weapons rises on its own like a tidal wave of riches, with a cold and determined face.*

name: Horakh
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: *Resembling a cave cricket the size of a dog, this beast's black, chitinous thorax is topped by a translucent digestive sac. Halfdigested eyeballs of various sizes and colors float in the sac.*

name: Hound of the Night
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: *This enormous black hound pants in the moonlight, wisps of steam rising from its muzzle, as it follows its elvish master.*

name: Hraesvelgr
subtitle: Huge Giant (Shapechanger Titan)
description: *The giant stands braced in the midst of powerful wind. With a baleful stare, he shakes his fist and bellows a war cry. The cry becomes an avian shriek, and the giant's form melts into that of a massive bird whose wings blot out the sky*.

name: Hulking Whelp
subtitle: Small Fey (Shapechanger)
description: *This gray-skinned dog-like creature seems pathetically eager to please but fantastically skittish, its ears alerting at every nearby sound, and its large oval eyes following anything that passes by.*

name: Hundun
subtitle: Large Celestial
description: *A toothless mouth adorns the headless shoulders of this oversized, four-armed, doughy humanoid. Colors and half-formed phantasmal shapes appear and vanish around it, to the creature's obvious delight.*

name: Ice Maiden
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *This alluring beauty has flesh and hair as white as snow and eyes as blue as glacial ice.*

name: Idolic Deity
subtitle: Small Construct
description: *This small demonic idol emits a palpable malice.*

name: Imperial Ghoul
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *An imperial ghoul stands tall and proud, its gray flesh robust and muscled, and its clothing strangely well kept. Its flickering red eyes have an intelligent, malicious gleam.*

name: Ink Devil
subtitle: Small Fiend (Devil)
description: *This small devil wears a small red hat. A wicked grin flashes black teeth, and the creature nervously wrings its hands, baring long, needle-like claws.*

name: Iron Ghoul
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *A vicious-looking ghoul carries a cruel glaive, its forearms stained with dried blood. Its glowing, rust-colored eyes penetrate with a calculating stare of restrained hunger.*

name: Isonade
subtitle: Gargantuan Monstrosity
description: *The creature's mighty tail thrashes ships, docks, and sailors in its path of destruction.*

name: J'ba Fofi Spider
subtitle: Large Beast
description: *A large, brown spider that resembles a tarantula with exaggeratedly long legs gracefully emerges from the bushes, followed by similar arachnids that are smaller and yellow in color.*

name: Jaculus
subtitle: Small Dragon
description: *This small dragon has feathered wings on its forearms and clings with powerful claws to a tree.*

name: Jotun
subtitle: Gargantuan Giant
description: *The earth shudders with every footfall of this massive giant.*

name: Kalke
subtitle: Small Fiend
description: *Combining the head of a goat and the body of a monkey, this creature exhibits the social grace of a baboon with the pretensions of a scholar.*

name: Kikimora
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *This strange-looking humanoid combines the features of an old crone and some manner of bird. A shawl covers her head but cannot contain her prominent beak and clawed hands. Her skirt reveals bird-like feet*.

name: Kishi Demon
subtitle: Medium Fiend (Demon)
description: *This strong and handsome warrior has a snarling hyena's face at the back of its head.*

name: Kobold Alchemist
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Kobold)
description: *This slight, reptilian humanoid is bedecked with ceramic flasks and glass vials. An acrid reek follows in its wake.*

name: Kobold Chieftain
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Kobold)
description: *This small, draconic humanoid struts as though it were ten feet tall. It wears the gilded skull of a small dragon as a helmet, and its beady eyes gleam out through the skull's sockets. It hefts its spear and shield and lets out a blood-curdling shriek, signaling the attack*.

name: Kobold Trapsmith
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Kobold)
description: *This kobold is bedecked in satchels, pouches, sacks, and bandoliers. All of these are bursting with tools, bits of scrap, wire, cogs, and twine. Impossibly large eyes blink through the lenses of its goggles*.

name: Kongamato
subtitle: Large Beast
description: *This large pterodactyl has emergent feathers and a long, beaklike jaw.*

name: Koralk Devil
subtitle: Large Fiend (Devil)
description: *The fiendish hulk bears features taken from a nightmare scorpion, with three stinging tails and four limbs. It wields a massive scythe.*

name: Kot Bayun
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: *This oddly colored cat appears at first to be a powerful panther of some kind. Its wide mouth pulls into something like a human grin, and its knowing eyes hint at intelligence beyond that of a typical jungle cat.*

name: Krake Spawn
subtitle: Huge Monstrosity
description: *This twisted, beast looks like the unholy union of squid and spider. Its shell-covered core has six small rubbery legs, peculiar antennae, and six tentacles around a squid's enormous beak.*

name: Lake Troll
subtitle: Large Giant
description: *This large, lanky creature has arms too long for its body. Its hands are webbed and equipped with wicked claws. Its skin is covered in dull green scales and embedded with stones, and limp hair like scraggly seaweed hangs across its long-nosed face*.

name: Lantern Dragonette
subtitle: Tiny Dragon
description: *This cat-sized drake with a waxy appearance and a glow emanating from its belly can hover in midair, filling a small area with a warm glow.*

name: Lemurfolk
subtitle: Small Humanoid (Lemurfolk)
description: *This furred humanoid glides silently through the canopy of trees, gripping a blowgun. It observes visitors cautiously with two intelligent, bulbous eyes.*

name: Leshy
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: *This strange man is covered in bark and root-like growths and wears loose scraps of clothing. The hair and beard that frame his piercing green eyes writhe like living vines.*

name: Library Automaton
subtitle: Small Construct
description: *The humming of servos, ticking of gears, and petite discharges of steam precede the library's diminutive custodian.*

name: Lich Hound
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *Half bone, half purple fire, this deathly hound releases an eerie howl that echoes with the voices of the damned.*

name: Likho
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: *This goblin-like creature bears one large, strange eye in the middle of its face. It wears dark and dirty rags, and its spindly claws and arms match its hunched torso.*

name: Lindwurm
subtitle: Large Dragon
description: *Coiling like a living corkscrew and moving with a scraping hiss, this serpentine creature skates nimbly across ice on long curving claws, maw agape and stinking of a hundred graves.*

name: Liosalfar
subtitle: Large Elemental
description: *The curtain of rippling colors assumes a humanoid form. Its kaleidoscope body shifts and glitters with mesmeric patterns.*

name: Living Wick
subtitle: Small Construct
description: *The small, rough wax sculpture of a human stands at attention, a halo of light flickering around its head from some source behind it.*

name: Lord of the Hunt
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *Astride a midnight horse sits a shirtless elven huntsman. His broad chest is thickly muscled and sports tattooed knot work. Great stag antlers crest the huntsman's head, curving above his rich brown hair. The pale green glow that shines from his eyes obscures the elf 's strong features, and a massive spear twined with glowing green vines drives forward in his clenched fist*.

name: Lorelei
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *Lounging on a large river rock, this breathtaking fey calls plaintively to travelers.*

name: Loxoda
subtitle: Huge Monstrosity
description: *This massive creature combines the torso of an ogre and the body of an elephant as it lumbers through the open plains.*

name: Lunar Devil
subtitle: Large Fiend (Devil)
description: *A hulking figure floats in the air, a winged horror painted in mist and moonlight.*

name: Mahoru
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: *A white fin cut the surface of the water as the serpentine creature approached. Its wolfish head burst from the surface, revealing a body covered in fine, white fur.*

name: Malakbel Demon
subtitle: Medium Fiend (Demon)
description: *Within a blinding wave of heat and glare walks a long-limbed, misshapen form. The creature scorches everything in its path as it strides forward.*

name: Mallqui
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *With skin stretched like vellum over wizened limbs, a desiccated humanoid form clad in splendid regalia emerges from a funerary tower. The imposing figure has yellow points of light for eyes.*

name: Malphas
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *Keen eyed and dangerous, this winged fey warrior is dressed in finery.*

name: Mamura
subtitle: Small Aberration
description: *This atrocity combines the worst elements of a dead frog and a rotting fish. Its slimy, scaly, vaguely humanoid form has eyes and three clawed arms arranged radially about its body. Its green, bat-like wings seem too small to work, yet it flies well*.

name: Map Mimic
subtitle: Tiny Monstrosity (Shapechanger)
description: *A treasure map flaps as if caught in a strong wind. It suddenly splits open, revealing a fanged mouth and face.*

name: Mask Wight
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *The frame of this withered demon's corpse barely fills the ash-colored plate armor that encases it. It carries a khopesh made of violet smoke, and a horned ivory mask devoid of features is nailed to its face.*

name: Mavka
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *With burnt and blackened skin, burnt twigs for hair, and clawed hands and feet that resemble burnt and twisted roots, this creature appears scorched and even frail. Pupilless red eyes gleam in its sockets with a hellish green flame.*

name: Mbielu Dinosaur
subtitle: Huge Beast
description: *This lumbering saurian quadruped has large, oblong plates of bone covered in greenish slime protruding from its back and its thick, club-like tail.*

name: Mi-go
subtitle: Medium Plant
description: *This fungal, insectoid creature has stubby wings, multiple limbs, and a nightmarish head.*

name: Millitaur
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: *A purplish-black segmented worm the size of a horse, with hundreds of legs, black multifaceted eyes, and powerful mandibles wields a pair of stone axes.*

name: Mindrot Thrall
subtitle: Medium Plant
description: *A heavily cloaked figure reeks of decay, spreading a floating cloud of spores with every step.*

name: Mirager
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *Diaphanous veils cover a graceful woman, flowing like water across her as she dances through the dust.*

name: Miremal
subtitle: Small Fey
description: *A short, lean, biped emerges from the shadows. Fungi and mosses cover its pale-skinned body, growing into its flesh. Its green eyes weep bloody tears*.

name: Mirror Hag
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *This hunchbacked crone's sallow skin is covered with growths and lesions.*

name: Mithral Dragon Wyrmling
subtitle: Medium Dragon
description: *Light glints off the dragon's glossy scales, shining silver-white. Its tiny wings folded flush against its body open like a fan and expose shimmering, diaphanous membranes. Its narrow head, with bare slits for its eyes and nostrils, sits at the end of a slender neck atop an impossibly thin frame*.

name: Mngwa
subtitle: Medium Aberration
description: *Tiny wisps of grayish smoke ooze from the slate-colored coat of this leonine creature.*

name: Monolith Champion
subtitle: Large Construct
description: *This suit of armor stands motionless, its visor raised to reveal a black skull with eyes cold as a winter moon. A cloak of owl feathers hangs from its shoulders, and a greatsword sits across its back.*

name: Monolith Footman
subtitle: Large Construct
description: *A suit of elven parade armor, beautifully ornate but perhaps not terribly functional, stands at attention.*

name: Moonlit King
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *Dressed in archaic nobleman's finery, this elf lord has wildly unkempt bluish hair and pale, almost luminous skin. His eyes bulge slightly from their sockets as they stare vacantly. The lord's shadow moves slightly out of sync with his body, which appears solid in some portions and nearly transparent in others*.

name: Mordant Snare
subtitle: Gargantuan Aberration
description: *The ground rumbles and a gigantic starfish with eleven arms rises from the earth, grasping at nearby prey.*

name: Morphoi
subtitle: Medium Plant (Shapechanger)
description: *This blue-skinned humanoid wields a trident and has an unusual face with vertical eyes but no mouth or nose.*

name: Moss Lurker
subtitle: Small Humanoid
description: *Somewhat like the cruel crossbreed of troll and gnome, this creature has a long, greenish beard and hair. Its hide is peaty amber, and a vaguely fungal scent surrounds it.*

name: Myling
subtitle: Small Undead
description: *Dressed in rags, this small humanoid has cold, blue skin and large, black eyes.*

name: Naina
subtitle: Large Dragon (Shapechanger)
description: *This draconic creature is plumed and scaled in glittering, multicolored hues.*

name: Necrohydra
subtitle: Huge Undead
description: *Five snaking necks sprout from this decayed, draconic body. However, instead of reptilian heads, each neck ends in a humanoid head.*

name: Ngobou Dinosaur
subtitle: Large Beast
description: *This ill-tempered, six-horned creature resembles a triceratops the size of an ox, with pairs of horns atop its nose and brows, as well as great tusks jutting from each side of its mouth.*

name: Nichny
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *These ancient creatures resemble nothing so much as black cats dressed in sumptuous, archaic, clothing.*

name: Night Scorpion
subtitle: Large Beast
description: *These midnight-black scorpions have a bright-red stripe on their tails, signaling the crippling poison within.*

name: Nightgarm
subtitle: Large Monstrosity
description: *This red-furred lupine creature has a too-wide mouth and blood-soaked claws.*

name: Nihileth Aboleth
subtitle: Large Undead
description: *Eons ago, a group of aboleth left the Material Plane to wander through distant planes—seeing them through magical scrying was not enough, so these aboleth used astral magic and bodily travel to see far beyond normal realms*.

name: Nihilethic Dominator
subtitle: Large Undead
description: *Eons ago, a group of aboleth left the Material Plane to wander through distant planes—seeing them through magical scrying was not enough, so these aboleth used astral magic and bodily travel to see far beyond normal realms*.

name: Nihilethic Zombie
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *Eons ago, a group of aboleth left the Material Plane to wander through distant planes—seeing them through magical scrying was not enough, so these aboleth used astral magic and bodily travel to see far beyond normal realms*.

name: Nkosi
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Nkosi Shapechanger)
description: *With a thick mane of beaded locks, this leonine humanoid grins with a mouthful of pointed teeth.*

name: Nkosi Pridelord
subtitle: Medium Humanoid (Nkosi Shapechanger)
description: *With a thick mane of beaded locks, this leonine humanoid grins with a mouthful of pointed teeth.*

name: Noctiny
subtitle: Medium Humanoid
description: *A grinning man brandishes a staff surmounted by a rune-covered skull. Blasphemous sigils adorn his clothes, and ashes stain his skin a sickly gray.*

name: Oculo Swarm
subtitle: Large Aberration
description: *This collection of hundreds of eyes floats along, trailing ganglia and dripping caustic fluid that sizzles when it hits the ground.*

name: Ogre Corrupted Chieftain
subtitle: Large Giant
description: *Spikes adorn the green skin of this large ogre, and it brandishes a nail-studded club.*

name: Oozasis
subtitle: Gargantuan Ooze
description: *The oasis appears as an idyllic desert respite, offering water, shade, and even edible fruit and nuts in the trees above.*

name: Orobas Devil
subtitle: Large Fiend (Devil)
description: *Tall and powerful, this creature resembles a strong man with well-chiseled muscles, save its equine head, flaring nostrils, and hoofed feet.*

name: Ostinato
subtitle: Medium Aberration
description: *A bit of catchy, repetitive music emanates from nowhere, drifting and moving as if dancing in the empty air.*

name: Owl Harpy
subtitle: Medium Monstrosity
description: *This winged woman's face is wreathed in a headdress of feathers; her luminous eyes and aquiline nose lend beauty to her feral demeanor. Her sharp, taloned feet seem even more inhuman by comparison.*

name: Pact Vampire
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *Blood flows up the slain man's body, defying gravity as it makes its way into the skin and fanged maw of this wild-haired vampire.*

name: Paper Drake
subtitle: Small Dragon
description: *With its sharp angles and translucent skin, this draconic creature looks as if it were carefully folded from a massive sheet of paper, including its razor-sharp claws and teeth.*

name: Planewatcher
subtitle: Medium Celestial
description: *The brilliant lasso tightened around the eldritch monster as the faceless winged creature dragged it across a hellish landscape.*

name: Pombero
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *This squat little man has long limbs and skin the color of coal. The backs of its hands and tops of its feet are covered in thick hair. Its face seems a bit too wide for its head, and its eyes gleam a little too brightly in the pale light*.

name: Possessed Pillar
subtitle: Large Construct
description: *This ancient animal-headed pillar is engraved with weathered symbols from ancient empires.*

name: Psoglav Demon
subtitle: Large Fiend (Demon)
description: *An immense creature sniffs at the air, its singular eye glowing with malice.*

name: Putrid Haunt
subtitle: Medium Undead
description: *This shambling corpse has twigs, branches, and other debris intertwined with its body. Its gaping maw crawls with scrabbling vermin.*

name: Queen of Night and Magic
subtitle: Medium Fey
description: *A fey lady of stunning beauty with hair the color of midnight stands before a shining field of stars. A gown seemingly woven from the night sky drapes her flawless ivory skin. Bright lights glitter like diamonds in her crown and raiment, and some drift about her body and dance near her hand*.

name: Queen of Witches
subtitle: Large Fey
description: *This statuesque woman towers over any tall man and most ogres. Her hair falls in a cascade of curls and looks as if it is spun from copper.
